page.title: 18THE LOSH FAMILY _ WREAY(I)
page.content: Most of the land around Wreay used to belong to the Losh family.In the 18th century the "laird" was John Losh, known popularly as{"The Big Black {Squire"}.He was the last of the Cumberland squirearchy to take part in the border expeditions that ended after the 1745 rebellion.He had 8 children,most of whom became successful businessmen.His eldest son settled on the Woodside Estate near Wreay.He has left his mark on the district because,being a prominent agriculturist,he was responsible for introducing Italian rye grass into Cumberland and for planting a large number of larch and oak trees.These are still a feature of the area.He was interested in the connection between chemistry and agriculture and his experiments at Woodside led local folk to suspect witchcraft and magic.
